title: Structuring Collaborative Learning Activities for Scientific Problem-Solving

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of fundamental science theories and research methodologies
context.additional_context: Environment supporting smartphone-based collaborative tools, with emphasis on project outcome-based evaluation

learning_goals: Learners can accurately design science problem-solving steps at least 80% of the time using Collaborative Learning Flow Patterns (CLFP).
Learners can structure scientific discussion processes according to time/rule constraints by applying the Process-Driven Collaborative Editing Pattern (PDCEP).
Learners can finalize project deliverables through peer evaluation and feedback using smartphone-based collaborative tools.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
